intro: Milula spicata, commonly known as the spike millet, is an annual grass species native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny grains. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a bluish-green hue. Milula spicata is often cultivated as a forage crop and has historical significance in traditional agriculture.
